description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives (PDO) of this Additional Financing is to improve targeting of social protection programs and provide income support to poor households through LEAP grants and LIPW infrastructure in targeted districts.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Gender, Children and Social Protection
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. H. | Description :By no later than December 1, 2011, prepare and deliver to theAssociation a post-national consultation draft policy on the use of labor-intensive methods. | Due Date :01-Dec-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section D2 (a) | Description :The Recipient shall not later than three (3) months after theEffective Date, engage an independent expert to verify the list of Cash Transfer Beneficiaries for the purpose of Part C.1 of theProject in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Schedule, whose terms of reference, qualifications and experienceand terms and conditions of employment shall be satisfactory to the Assoc. | Due Date :30-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2. Section D2 (b) | Description :The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after theEffective Date, submit to the Association the technical audit reportsatisfactory to the Association related to the use of theproceeds of the Cash Transfer for the first three months of the Project and, thereafter, not later than forty-five (45) days afterthe end of each nine (9) calendar months, submit indep. verification reports. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Cash-for-work, food-for-work and public works (number)
Beneficiaries of Safety Nets programs - Female (number)
Direct project beneficiaries under LIPW component
Average annual earnings of unskilled workers in LIPWs (cedi)
Payments to workers under LIPW program made within 20 days after the attendance at work sites
Potential and actual beneficiaries in participating districts satisfied with subprojects, LIPW program and LEAP transfers (%)
Direct project beneficiaries under cash transfer component
Original name: Maintenance program established for roads and dams. Revised name: District Assemblies with maintenance programs established for completed sub-projects (number)
Enrolled beneficiaries in the districts where LEAP pilot will be intensified (% increase)
Total unskilled worker earnings as share of LIPW cost
Original name: Rehabilitated dams inspected annually by communities for dam safety concerns. Revised name: Completed subprojects inspected annually by Communities (under spn of district tech. spc).
Original name: Working group to set priorities for social protection indicators to be set under MoFEP leadership. Revised name: Social Protection Policy drafted by MoGCSP and submitted to cabinet
LEAP administrative costs compared to total costs
Original name: Payments made to contractors after receipt of performance security. Revised name: Avg time lapse between submission of interim certificate by LIPW contractors and payments by DAs
Targeting performance (share of LEAP beneficiaries from the poorest 20% of population)
Share of beneficiaries from the poorest 20% of population for LEAP and poorest 30% of the population for LIPW.
Small earth dams and dug-outs rehabilitated (number)
Area Planted for Fruit Trees and Multi-Purpose Woodlots (ha)
Private contractors techically capable of implementing and supervising LIPW.
